title: Altman calls for the establishment of a global AI regulatory body in New Delhi, warning of the approaching era of super artificial intelligence.
summary: According to Outlook India, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman delivered a keynote speech at the "AI Impact Summit 2026" in New Delhi, India. At the summit, Altman formally called for the establishment of a global AI regulatory body to address the growing technological risks. He made a striking prediction: by 2028, most of the world's intellectual capacity will reside in data centers. Altman emphasized that with superintelligence potentially emerging in the coming years, society needs time to integrate and understand each technological stage. The international community must remain humble about the still-undefined risks and establish collaborative governance frameworks as early as possible. Furthermore, the summit also discussed the pressures AI development will place on water resources and its potential to boost global employment.

title: India's Maharashtra state allocates 100 acres of land to support semiconductor manufacturing.
summary: According to EquityBulls, India's semiconductor industry has taken another crucial step in its localization process. The Maharashtra state government officially announced yesterday the allocation of 100 acres of land to leading semiconductor company RRP Electronics Ltd. for the construction of its semiconductor manufacturing facilities. According to this station, this land transfer is a core part of the state's strategy to strengthen its electronics manufacturing sector and build a local semiconductor ecosystem. This project not only represents the concrete implementation of India's national semiconductor strategy at the local level but also indicates that India is accelerating its efforts to secure a place in the global chip supply chain through increased administrative resources.
